newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai interbank rate down again, baht firmer late.
newsitem.headline: Thai interbank rate down again, baht firmer late.

text.p: The Thai overnight interbank rate eased to a three-month low of 4.50-5.00 percent in late trade on Thursday from 5.75 percent earlier and 6.00-7.00 percent late on Wednesday on an extremely high money supply, dealers said.
Dealers said liquidity was high because banks were trying to lend out reduce surplus funds after the passing of central bank reserve requirements on thursday.
"The interbank rate is likelty to rebound tomorrow as banks will take advantage of the low rate to accumulate funds for the next reserve requirements," said a dealer at a foreign bank.
All commercial banks have to meet the Bank of Thailand reserve requirements on the seventh and 22nd of every month.
The baht edged up to 25.296-25.299 to the dollar in late trade from 25.297-25.302 earlier on local dollar selling, dealers said.

"I heard some offshore banks were selling dollars in order to reduce long dollar position," said a currency dealer. "But there was little interest for dollars today as most players have already squared their positions."
The one-month swap premium was at 6.75/7.50 satangs per dollar late compared with 7.00 earlier.
The mid-rate was fixed unchanged at 25.30 baht to the dollar.
